intro: Fuirena nudiflora, commonly known as the naked-flower fumitory, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish flowers that appear in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. Fuirena nudiflora is part of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms.
